intro: Oreocarya setosissima, commonly known as the hairy oreocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and the presence of dense, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Oreocarya setosissima is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
